H0.text: the era of the great mughals began with the accession of. Akbar

H1.text: the era of the great mughals began with the accession of. Humayun

H2.text: the era of the great mughals began with the accession of. Shah Jahan

H3.text: the era of the great mughals began with the accession of. Babur

A4.text: The Mughal Empire is conventionally said to have been founded in 1526 by Babur, a ruler from what is now Uzbekistan, who with the help of the neighbouring Safavid and Ottoman Empires defeated the sultan of Delhi, Ibrahim Lodi, in the First Battle of Panipat and swept down the plains of North India.

A5.text: The Mughal imperial structure, however, is sometimes dated to 1600, to the rule of Babur's grandson, Akbar.

A6.text: Babur was the founder of the Mughal Empire in the Indian subcontinent.

A7.text: Babur died in Agra on 5 January [O.S. 26 December 1530] 1531 and was succeeded by his eldest son, Humayun.
